other_tests.findings: Most patients had a mild to moderate reduction in visual acuity with acuities ranging from 20/20 to 20/60 in 40% of cases, 20/70 to 20/100 in 45% of cases, and from 20/200 to 20/600 in 15% of cases.
Color vision as tested with Hardy-Rand-Rittler plates was reduced (4.0/10, average of 4.0 out of 10 correct plates).
Demonstrated central or paracentral scotomas in seven of the eight patients.
A cup-to-disc ratio of more than 0.5 was observed in at least one eye of eight patients, moderate to severe temporal pallor in all eyes, and the presence of gray crescents in all eyes.
All patients had normal intraocular pressures (mean, 15.0 mmHg; range, 10â€“19 mmHg).
